alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Goodhue; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 8:59AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Dakota, northeastern Goodhue, southeastern Washington, northwestern Pepin, Pierce, southwestern Dunn and southern St. Croix Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 859 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prescott to 6 miles southwest of Ellsworth to near Red Wing. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ellsworth, Bay City and Frontenac around 905 AM CDT. Roberts around 915 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Plum City, Baldwin, Hammond, Elmwood, Durand, Woodville and Eau Galle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 in Wisconsin between mile markers 8 and 27. U.S. Highway 61 between mile markers 82 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Minnesota...and west central Wisconsin.
